com.acs.bluetooth

Class Acr3901us1Reader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acs.bluetooth.BluetoothReader
      • com.acs.bluetooth.Acr3901us1Reader

  • public class Acr3901us1Reader
extends BluetoothReader
    The Acr3901us1Reader class represents ACR3901U-S1 Bluetooth readers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Acr3901us1Reader.OnBatteryStatusAvailableListener
      Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when the battery status is available.
      static interface  Acr3901us1Reader.OnBatteryStatusChangeListener
      Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when the battery status is changed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Acr3901us1Reader

        public Acr3901us1Reader()
        Creates an instance of Acr3901us1Reader.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        public boolean authenticate(byte[] masterKey)
        Authenticates the reader. In order to proceed this operation, your reader must be connected and bonded successfully. If you want to receive the authentication result, you need to register a callback using setOnAuthenticationCompleteListener() method.
        Specified by:
        authenticate in class BluetoothReader
        Parameters:
        masterKey - the master key. The length must be 16 bytes.
        Returns:
        true if the reader is connected, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of masterKey is not equal to 16 bytes long.

      • enableNotification

        public boolean enableNotification(boolean enabled)
        Enables the reader's battery status, card status and response notifications. If you want to receive the result, you need to register the callback by calling setOnEnableNotificationCompleteListener() method. If you want to receive these status change notifications, you need to register callback by using the following methods:
        • setOnBatteryStatusChangeListener()
        • setOnCardStatusChangeListener()
        Specified by:
        enableNotification in class BluetoothReader
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if start to listen reader's status change, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        true if this operation was initiated successfully, otherwise false.

      • getBatteryStatus

        public boolean getBatteryStatus()
        Gets the battery status. The reader must be bonded before this operation. If you want to receive the result, you need to register the callback by calling setOnBatteryStatusAvailableListener() method.
        Returns:
        true if the reader is connected, otherwise false.

      • getCardStatus

        public boolean getCardStatus()
        Gets the card status. If you want to receive the result, you need to register the callback by calling setOnCardStatusAvailableListener() method.
        Specified by:
        getCardStatus in class BluetoothReader
        Returns:
        true if the reader is connected, otherwise false.

      • getDeviceInfo

        public boolean getDeviceInfo(int infoId)
        Gets the device information. If you want to receive the result, you need to register the callback by calling setOnDeviceInfoAvailableListener() method.
        Specified by:
        getDeviceInfo in class BluetoothReader
        Parameters:
        infoId - the identity of the information to be read.
        Returns:
        true if the reader is connected, otherwise false.

      • powerOffCard

        public boolean powerOffCard()
        Powers off the card. If you want to receive the result of power off card, you need to register a callback using setOnCardPowerOffCompleteListener() method.
        Specified by:
        powerOffCard in class BluetoothReader
        Returns:
        true if the reader is connected, otherwise false.

      • powerOnCard

        public boolean powerOnCard()
        Powers on the card. If you want to receive the result of power on card, you need to register a callback using setOnAtrAvailableListener() method.
        Specified by:
        powerOnCard in class BluetoothReader
        Returns:
        true if the reader is connected, otherwise false.

      • setOnBatteryStatusAvailableListener

        public void setOnBatteryStatusAvailableListener(Acr3901us1Reader.OnBatteryStatusAvailableListener listener)
        Registers a callback to be invoked when the battery status is available.
        Parameters:
        listener - the callback that will run.

      • setOnBatteryStatusChangeListener

        public void setOnBatteryStatusChangeListener(Acr3901us1Reader.OnBatteryStatusChangeListener listener)
        Registers a callback to be invoked when the battery status change notification is received.
        Parameters:
        listener - the battery status change callback that will run.

      • startBonding

        public void startBonding()
        Starts the bonding process with the reader. You need to register android.content.BroadcastReceiver to receive the bond state change callback.

      • transmitApdu

        public boolean transmitApdu(byte[] apdu)
        Transmits the APDU. The reader must be authenticated before this operation. If you want to receive the response APDU, you need to register a callback using setOnResponseApduAvailableListener() method.
        Specified by:
        transmitApdu in class BluetoothReader
        Parameters:
        apdu - the APDU to be sent.
        Returns:
        true if the reader is connected, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the apdu is empty or zero length.
        See Also:
        authenticate(byte[])

      • transmitEscapeCommand

        public boolean transmitEscapeCommand(byte[] escapeCommand)
        Transmits the escape command. If you want to receive the result of transmit escape command, you need to register a callback using setOnEscapeResponseAvailableListener() method.
        Specified by:
        transmitEscapeCommand in class BluetoothReader
        Parameters:
        escapeCommand - the escape command to be sent.
        Returns:
        true if the reader is connected, otherwise false.
